result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Cassidy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
-Fine to be paid within 90 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

-Costs to be paid within 90 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
 Department. 
-Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to City of Brookfield Police Department.

-Huber with release for employment and treatment. 
-Sentence credit of 5 days is granted. 
-Sentence commencing Forthwith.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:37 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L Cassidy in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for James L Cassidy.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed in the document.  State and Atty. Simon confirm the offer.   Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in.  

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Simon.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:
4 Months Huber with release for employment and treatment (5 Days Credit).  Sentence commences immediately.

DL REVOCATION:  30 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 30 months.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through	

FINE:  $1,544.00 (includes IID surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $29.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Brookfield Police Department.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid within 90 days. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:00 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L Cassidy in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon in court for James L Cassidy. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  Atty. Simon provides an update, he advises that this matter is prepared to be resolved but he just received an offer in 21CF1803 and needs additional time to review it with his client and discuss it with the ADA assigned.  Atty. Simon requests that this matter be adjourned for a new plea and sentencing date in about 30 days and have 21CF1803 tag along with for status.  State has no objection.  Court will adjourn this matter for plea and sentencing and 21CF1803 for status.  Atty. Simon notes that if he is able to go to plea and sentencing in this matter he will advise the court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Simon advising parties are still working to resolve the matter so it will not be proceeding to plea and sentencing on 8/19/22.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

08:41 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant James L Cassidy in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Simon advises he filed a letter last week to reschedule the plea and sentencing date.  Atty. Simon presents additional statements, and notes he was still waiting on a pretrial offer in this matter which he has received today.  Atty. Simon requests a new plea and sentencing date.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
filed by Atty Simon requesting an adjournment of the plea/sentencing. **Reviewed by Judge Lau - the case will need to be called on the record on 7/12/22**
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant James L Cassidy in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Simon provides an update, he has an offer in this matter but not in 21CF1803 yet.  Atty. Simon is asking both matters be set for plea and sentencing in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:40 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant James L Cassidy in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Simon provides an update; he has discovery and an offer in this matter but is waiting for blood test results in the other matter as well as an offer.  Atty. Simon requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:18 AM Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L Cassidy in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
